intro: Psiadia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed psiadia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss. Psiadia stenophylla produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
